section.title: Application Programming Interfaces
section.para: The services of the eSciDoc Infrastructure offer an application programming interface (API) which is based on the concept of Representational State Transfer (REST). It is a web-service protocol, which allows you invoking methods of services remotely in a language-independent manner. You work with resources and a restricted set of verbs (e.g., the verbs defined by HTTP).

A second option is the Java Interface Connector, which is targeted at Java developers. This connector hides the networking layer between eSciDoc Infrastructure and the application completely and provides a true object-oriented programming interface. The Java Interface Connector is not part of the eSciDoc Infrastructure and may be downloaded separately from the eSciDoc website (http://www.escidoc.org/). It comes with its own documentation and is thus not covered in this document.
